summary: The bill, titled the Withdrawing Arduous Gaming Excise Rates Act (WAGER Act), aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It seeks to exempt sports betting from the excise tax on authorized wagers. The bill specifies that the exemption applies to sports betting not prohibited by state law or tribal compacts, as defined by the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. The amendment would be effective for wagers placed after the date of the Act's enactment.
